Supply Chain Officer Job at Triumph Power and Gas Systems Limited




        
    

        
        Triumph Power and Gas Systems Limited is an integrated energy service company with a keen interest in diverse areas of power, oil and gas (upstream and midstream) and non-oil sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Experience Level: Experienced Professionals

Position Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for managing end-to-end procurement, sourcing, and logistics processes to ensure timely, cost-effective, and compliant delivery of goods and services.
	The role involves vendor management, quotation and order processing, customer engagement, and implementation of cost-saving and process improvement initiatives that support business growth.


Essential Job Functions


	Source quality materials, equipment, and services from approved suppliers or OEMs
	Process RFQs, obtain freight costs, and prepare competitive client quotations
	Follow up on submitted quotes to secure purchase orders and maintain accurate records.
	Coordinate with freight forwarders and logistics providers for timely shipment and delivery.
	Inspect and verify received goods against purchase orders and report discrepancies.
	Maintain professional relationships with suppliers, clients, and internal stakeholders.
	Track and control procurement costs in line with approved budgets and targets
	Collect and analyze supply chain data to support strategic decision-making.
	Support cost-saving and logistics optimization initiatives.
	Update procurement Tracker and Logs and ensure accurate documentation and compliance.


Requirements
Education:


	Minimum of an HND or Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business, or Supply Chain Management.


Minimum Experience:


	4 years+ of sourcing or procurement experience
	Experience in the energy, industrial, or technical services sector is an added advantage


Skills & Knowledge:


	Good knowledge of sourcing, vendor management, and procurement processes
	Strong analytical and negotiation skills
	Excellent organizational and documentation skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Office applications
	Basic understanding of contract and purchase order terms.


Professional Memberships:


	CIPS (student or Affiliated) or equivalent.


Technical Skills & Competence Requirements:


	Proficient in Use of Microsoft Excel
	Conversant with ERP Platforms.


Behavioural Competencies:


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Proactive, with a sense of ownership and urgency
	High level of integrity and attention to detail
	Ability to work well independently and as part of a team
	Professionalism in dealing with internal and external stakeholders.

Administrative Officer Job at XFP Productions




        
    

        
        XFP Productions is a dynamic media and creative agency committed to delivering top-tier content, storytelling, and production experiences. We value creativity, collaboration, and excellence — and we’re looking for a proactive Administrative Officer to help keep our operations organized, efficient, and running smoothly behind the scenes.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Administrative Officer will play a key role in supporting the day-to-day administrative, operational, and organizational needs of XFP Productions.
	The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, efficient, and capable of maintaining structure in a fast-paced creative environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily administrative operations to ensure seamless workflow across departments.
	Manage correspondence, documentation, and internal communication efficiently.
	Maintain and organize office files, staff records, and administrative databases.
	Support HR functions such as onboarding, attendance tracking, and general staff welfare.
	Handle procurement of office supplies, logistics coordination, and vendor relationships.
	Schedule meetings, manage calendars, and assist in preparing reports and meeting minutes.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, event logistics, and production-related administrative needs.
	Ensure a conducive and professional work environment that reflects the company’s creative culture.
	Liaise with internal teams to ensure timely communication and task follow-ups.
	Perform other administrative tasks as assigned by management.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, or any related field.
	2 - 4 years of relevant administrative experience (experience in a media, production, or creative company is a strong advantage).
	Excellent organizational, communication, and multitasking skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and digital communication tools.
	Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with creative and technical teams.
	High level of professionalism, discretion, and attention to detail.
	Ability to adapt quickly, manage multiple priorities, and thrive in a fast-paced environment


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrxfactorproductions@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Our mission is to help young children attain academic excellence while also giving them an early head start in fields that are very valuable in this evolving world.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Description

	Must be a good conversationalist and extroverted.
